snippet: The address used for a Bedford chocolate shop has been a hub for other enterprises of the family of Yoo Hyuk-kee, who is charged in a sinking that killed 304 people.
abstract: Bedford, NY, chocolate shop is owned by family of Yoo Hyuk-kee, who is charged in South Korean ferry disaster that killed 304 in April, and was a hub for other family enterprises; prosecutors are building case showing family members and confidantes controlled ferry company through a web of companies and drained it of assets that could have been spent on safety.

byline.original: By ALISON LEIGH COWAN and CHOE SANG-HUN
byline.contributor: Alison Leigh Cowan reported from Bedford, and Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul, South Korea. Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The address used for a Bedford chocolate shop has been a hub for other enterprises of the family of Yoo Hyuk-kee, who is charged in a sinking that killed 304 people.

headline.main: In Suburban New York, an Unlikely Link to a South Korean Ferry Disaster
headline.print_headline: Unlikely Link to a Korean Ferry Disaster
